channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter and weeds, 19th September
item.description:
The whole area around crittals roundabout needs litter picking and weeding. Large weed are growing out of the cobbled edges, the whole area looks abandoned and dirty. Not been done for years.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crittall's Corner, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bushes over grown, 19th September
item.description:
Bushes are so over grown the footpath is now unusable. This has been reported for over 2 years now

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead, London

item.title: Beginning of Nelson Close. Lamp post no 1, 19th September
item.description:
This light has been off for a long time now. And it has been almost a week since reported and noone has come to fix this light. As me toned it's a light on a bend and this can cause a a danger for drivers as well as pedestrians

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nelson Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on traffic island safety bollards, 19th September
item.description:
Red 'england flag' graffiti on numerous pedestrian crossing safety bollards. This is illegal under the Criminal Damage Act 1971 and also breaches the Highway Code, which requires traffic infrastructure to remain clear and safe. Beyond the legal issues, this behaviour is stoking division, masking racism as “patriotism,” and creating fear within our community.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 210, Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Fly tipping on Gatonby Street

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gatonby Street, Peckham, London

item.title: Crystal Palace Park Road SE26 at College Road junction, 18th September
item.description:
Crystal Palace Park Road SE26 at College Road junction – on Crystal Palace Park side footpath a few yards south of the junction right next to traffic light pole is a black box (to control lights I assume) which is graffiti tagged. Not next to streetlight / property number. Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4238578,-0.0761975,3a,75y,91.42h,74.05t/data=!3m8!1e1!3m6!1s_LGuwbC-QqzbM0lypfQL4w!2e0!5s20241001T000000!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D15.951158868946706%26panoid%3D_LGuwbC-QqzbM0lypfQL4w%26yaw%3D91.42308927380034!7i16384!8i8192?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDkxNi4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Sign, 18th September
item.description:
On Gravel Hill near to the junction with Albion Road, Bexleyheath: A blue circular street sign for cyclists has fallen/dropped down from its column. Please could this sign be realigned to the correct height so that cyclists are able to see it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Hill, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Anerley Station Road SE20 8FD oppo, 18th September
item.description:

item.title: Anerley Road SE20 between Anerley Station Road and, 18th September

item.title: Dozens of Lime bikes blocking cycle lane and narrowing road, 18th September
item.description:
This situation happens every single day. Dozens of Lime bikes are parked in the early morning on Fetherstone street, narowing the road and clearly blocking the cycle lane that is heavily used by cyclists. This junction is quite tricky already and with Lime it is putting cyclists and pedestrians in danger. This happens every single day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Featherstone Street, Finsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter totally blocking alley, 18th September
item.description:
Some degenerate has emptied bags of litter into the alley between Touchard House and Charles Sq. Anyone wanting to walk here has to literally wade through filth. It is an urgent health hazard and whoever did this is pure scum. There is a bin right there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charles Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rosendale Road SE21 on public footpath between th, 18th September
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 on public footpath between the north end of Lairdale Estate and footpath streetlight column ID number 77 you have recently installed dual car charging points. At the back of footpath are two cabinets – one black (telecom) and green cabinet which I assume relates to car charges as new ie Lambeth property. Remove graffiti please. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture (shows back of chargers and said two cabinets and Google Streetview link – NB link does not show car charger and green cabinet as new:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22-23, Burrow Walk, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish not collected, 18th September
item.description:
For the past 2 weeks now the rubbish hasn't been picked up properly on time. Some days few would be left behind or not picked up at all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, D'Arblay Street, Camden Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
